question: In the following question, four sentences have been mentioned. One of the sentences may contain a grammatical or contextual error. Choose the sentence which contains the error. (a) She chose to abjure the toxic workplace culture, deciding to move on and pursue a new career path rather than continuing to deride her colleagues' efforts (b) Despite the initial success of the innovative technology, some traditionalists continued to decry its use, while others embraced it, spurning the old ways for the sake of progress (c) What started as an acrimonious disagreement between the neighbors over the property line eventually turned into an amicable resolution with the help of a mediator, fostering a more peaceful coexistence (d) Her flippancy during the serious discussion about the environmental crisis irritated her colleagues, as they felt the issue deserved more respect and attention (e) No error
answer: She chose to abjure the toxic workplace culture, deciding to move on and pursue a new career path rather than continuing to deride her colleagues' efforts
description: Traditional knowledge: She chose to abjure the toxic workplace culture, deciding to move on and pursue a new career path rather than continuing to deride her colleagues' efforts

question: Revolving Fund: DAY-NRLM, MoRD, would provide Revolving Fund (RF) support to SHGs in existence for a minimum period of 3/6 months and follow the norms of good SHGs, i.e. they follow 'Panchasutra'- regular meetings, regular savings, regular internal lending, regular recoveries and maintenance of proper books of accounts. Only such SHGs that have not received any RF earlier would be provided with RF, as with minimum corpus, a of __________ and up to a maximum of __________ RF strengthen their institutional financial and management capacity and build a good credit history within the group.
context: Traditional Knowledge - Agricultural Extension Education: Revolving Fund: DAY-NRLM, MoRD, would provide Revolving Fund (RF) support to SHGs in existence for a minimum period of 3/6 months and follow the norms of good SHGs, i.e. they follow 'Panchasutra'- regular meetings, regular savings, regular internal lending, regular recoveries and maintenance of proper books of accounts. Only such SHGs that have not received any RF earlier would be provided with RF, as with minimum corpus, a of __________ and up to a maximum of __________ RF strengthen their institutional financial and management capacity and build a good credit history within the group. Answer: 10000-15000. This relates to historic and traditional agricultural practices.

question:
Match List-I with List-II <@Table>List-l,List-II
(Extension teaching methods),(Descriptions of the method)
(A). Group Discussion,(1). Face-to-face contact by the extension agent with the farmers at their home or farm for a specific purpose related to extension work.
(B). Method Demonstration,(II). An extension method which is conducted by a participating farmer on his/her farm or home under the guidance of an extension worker to prove by the evidence that the practice being demonstrated is superior to the one in existence.
(C). Farm and Home Visit,"(III). A planned and purposive interchange of ideas and feelings among a small group of individuals under the supervision of a discussion leader, aimed at solving a common problem or planning a course of action."
(D). Result Demonstration,(IV). An extension method in which an extension agent or a trained leader or a specialist shows how to carry out an entirely new practice or an old practice in a better way to a group.</@Table> 
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
context:
Traditional Knowledge - General Knowledge & Reasoning: Match List-I with List-II <@Table>List-l,List-II
(Extension teaching methods),(Descriptions of the method)
(A). Group Discussion,(1). Face-to-face contact by the extension agent with the farmers at their home or farm for a specific purpose related to extension work.
(B). Method Demonstration,(II). An extension method which is conducted by a participating farmer on his/her farm or home under the guidance of an extension worker to prove by the evidence that the practice being demonstrated is superior to the one in existence.
(C). Farm and Home Visit,"(III). A planned and purposive interchange of ideas and feelings among a small group of individuals under the supervision of a discussion leader, aimed at solving a common problem or planning a course of action."
(D). Result Demonstration,(IV). An extension method in which an extension agent or a trained leader or a specialist shows how to carry out an entirely new practice or an old practice in a better way to a group.</@Table> 
Choose the correct answer from the options given below: Answer: (A) - (III), (B) - (IV), (C) - (I), (D) - (II). This relates to historic and traditional agricultural practices.

question: Match List-I with List-II List-I (Communication method) List-II (Meaning/purpose) (A). Farm and home visit (I). It is an intense educational activity for motivating and mobilising a community at an opportune time for action to solve a problem or satisfy a need urgently felt by it (II). It is a face-to-face contact by the extension agent with the farmers at his/her home (B). Result demonstration (III). It is carned out by an extension agent to show how to carry out an entirely new practice or an old practice in a better way to a group. (C). Method demonstration (IV). It is conducted by a participating farmer on his/her farm or home under the guidance of an extension worker to prove by the evidence that the practice being demonstrated is superior to the one in existence. It is carned out by an extension agent to show how to carry out an entirely new practice or an old practice in a better way to a group. (C). Method demonstration (IV). It is conducted by a participating farmer on his/her farm or home under the guidance of an extension worker to prove by the evidence that the practice being demonstrated is superior to the one in existence. question: When we write to inform our stakeholders about something they did not know before or is it to explain and give more information about something they already know? The why of writing

title: Traditional: Introduction
description: Organic farming is a sustainable agricultural system that avoids synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, and GMOs. In India, it has deep roots in traditional practices and Vedic agriculture, emphasizing natural harmony and soil fertility.
benefits: Organic farming is a sustainable agricultural system that avoids synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, and GMOs. In India, it has deep roots in tradition
content: Organic farming is a sustainable agricultural system that avoids synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, and GMOs. In India, it has deep roots in traditional practices and Vedic agriculture, emphasizing natural harmony and soil fertility.

title: Traditional: Conclusion
description: Organic farming blends ancient wisdom with modern sustainability. Reviving traditional methods like Panchagavya and Jeevamrutha, alongside biofertilizers and certification systems, can make Indian agriculture more resilient and eco-friendly.

content: Organic farming blends ancient wisdom with modern sustainability. Reviving traditional methods like Panchagavya and Jeevamrutha, alongside biofertilizers and certification systems, can make Indian agriculture more resilient and eco-friendly.
